description: Bond status change trap.
This notification indicates trap when bond status changes.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondBondStateChangeTrap HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondPriPort i 9999 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondAdminStatus i 1 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondPrimaryStatus i 2 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondSecondaryStatus b 0

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondBondStateChangeTrap HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondPriPort i 9999 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondAdminStatus i 1 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondPrimaryStatus i 1 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondSecondaryStatus b 0

description: Index of the bonding group, which should be equal to the ifindex of the primary port.
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondPriPort

description: The admin status of the bonding group, when the admin-status is down, no service
should be allowed.
Options:
1. deactivate(1) - Deactivate status
2. activate(2) - Activate status
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondAdminStatus

description: The primary status of the bonding group. This parameter indicates the current overall
service condition of an entity, i.e., whether it is in-service or out-of-service.
Options:
1. is-nr(1) - In service, normal
2. is-anr(2) - In service, abnormal
3. is-rst(3) - In service, restricted
4. is-anrst(4) - In service, abnormal & restricted
5. oos-au(5) - Out of service, autonomous
6. oos-ma(6) - Out of service, management
7. oos-auma(7) - Out of service, autonomous & management
8. oos-aurst(8) - Out of service, autonomous & restricted
9. oos-maanr(9) - Out of service, management & abnormal
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondPrimaryStatus

description: This parameter indicates the secondary status of the bonding group. The parameter provides additional
information pertaining to PST and PSTQ. For example, it may indicate the type and reason of
the external command, the event that occurred in the Network Element, etc. Multiple values may
apply to an entity at a given moment. The highest bit of SST value indicates the sst-ains(0) status;
the second highest bit of SST value indicates the sst-faf(1) status, and the rest can be deduced by analogy.
This BITS structure can report the following status:
1. sst-ains(0) - This bit position positively reports that the status of the board is automatic in-service
2. sst-faf(1) - Facility failure
3. sst-flt(2) - Fault
4. sst-lpbk(3) - Loopback
5. sst-mea(4) - Mismatch of equipment and attributes
6. sst-sgeo(5) - Supporting entity outage
7. sst-stbyh(6) - Standby-hot
8. sst-ts(7) - Test
9. sst-uas(8) - Unassigned
10. sst-ueq(9) - Unequipped
11. sst-wrk(10) - Working
12. sst-pwr(11) - Power
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondSecondaryStatus

description: Bonding group profile ID change trap.
This notification indicates trap when bonding group profile ID changes.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondBondProfileChangeTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondPriPort i 9999 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondProfileID i 9999 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupProfName s EXAMPLE

description: The serial IP of configuration changes.
If the configuration changes is trigger by the command line users, the IP address is 0.0.0.0.
If it is triggered by the SNMP user, the IP address is the SNMP user's IP address.
The Trap of configuration changes will not be sent to the SNMP user
who triggered the configuration changes.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP

description: Index of the bonding group, which should be equal to the ifindex of the primary port.
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondPriPort

description: The bonding group profile ID.
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondProfileID

description: This object identifies a row in this table.
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupProfName

description: This notification indicates that the G.Bond port upstream
data rate has reached/dropped below or exceeded the low
upstream rate threshold.
REFERENCE [TR-159] 5.5.1.24

event.Summary: G.Bond upstream rate crossed low threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondLowUpRateCrossingAlarmTrap HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupID i 9999 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondUpDataRate i 9999 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupProfThreshLowDataRateUs u 9999

description: The bonding group ID.
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupID

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, indicating the physical number of the port on a board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: A current G.Bond port operational data rate in the upstream direction, in bps.
This object represents an estimation of the sum of individual
BCE upstream data rates, modified to compensate for fragmentation and
encapsulation overhead(e.g., for an ethernet service, the target data
rate of 10Mbps shall allow lossless transmission of full-duplex 10Mbps
ethernet frame stream with minimal inter-frame gap).
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondUpDataRate

description: This object configures the G.Bond port low upstream rate
crossing alarm threshold. The value of 0 means that the
low upstream data rate is not fixed.
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupProfThreshLowDataRateUs

description: This notification indicates that the G.Bond port downstream
data rate has reached/dropped below or exceeded the low
downstream rate threshold.
REFERENCE [TR-159] 5.5.1.25

event.Summary: G.Bond downstream rate crossed low threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondLowDownRateCrossingAlarmTrap HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupID i 9999 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondDownDataRate i 9999 HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupProfThreshLowDataRateDs u 9999

description: The bonding group ID.
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupID

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, indicating the physical number of the port on a board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: A current G.Bond port operational data rate in the downstream direction, in bps.
This object represents an estimation of the sum of individual
BCE downstream data rates, modified to compensate for fragmentation and
encapsulation overhead (e.g., for an ethernet service, the target data
rate of 10Mbps shall allow lossless transmission of full-duplex 10Mbps
ethernet frame stream with minimal inter-frame gap).
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondDownDataRate

description: This object configures the G.Bond port low downstream rate
crossing alarm threshold. The value of 0 means that the
low downstream data rate is not fixed.
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupProfThreshLowDataRateDs

description: This notification indicates that the G.Bond port connects with a
invalid CPE.

event.Summary: G.Bond port connect with invalid CPE

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondInvalidCpeAlarmTrap HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupID i 9999 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0

description: The bonding group ID.
variables.name: HUAWEI-GBOND-MIB::hwGBondGroupID

description: The index of a shelf in the device.

You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
